intro: Duguetia sanctae-crucis, commonly known as the Cross Mountains tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory tree in humid, lowland forests, reaching heights of up to 20 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or red and attract various pollinators, including birds and insects. The tree is valued for its ornamental qualities and has limited use in traditional medicine.
